email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and an LOA of 280m. The laycan is 15-20 October. Our starting freight quote is $52.50 per metric ton. Let me know if this works for you or if you’d like to discuss further. Best regards, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit higher than we were hoping for. Could you come down to the low 50s, say $50.75? Also, can you confirm the laytime and demurrage terms? Looking forward to your reply. Cheers, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I can offer $51.25 per metric ton, which is a competitive rate given the current market. Laytime is 72 hours total, and demurrage is set at $25,000 per day pro rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the revised offer. We can agree to $51.25, provided the laycan remains firm at 15-20 October. Please confirm the vessel’s availability and send over the draft charter party for review. Also, can you clarify if the demurrage rate is in USD? Best, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, great to hear that. Yes, the laycan is confirmed for 15-20 October, and the demurrage rate is in USD. I’ll send over the draft charter party by end of day today. Let me know if there’s anything else you need. Best regards, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the confirmation. I’ll review the charter party once received. Looking forward to finalizing this deal. Cheers, John.
